extracted_metadata.Author: SongChen
extracted_metadata.Description:
MOGADISHU, July 23 (Xinhua) -- Authorities in the semi- autonomous region of Puntland on Monday said they have seized a boatload of weapons smuggled from Yemen on Friday, a government statement said.

The authorities said the weapons were from the al Qaida in Yemen for local Al-Shabaab group in Somalia which has links with the radical international terror network.
extracted_metadata.Title: Somalia's Puntland authorities seize smuggled weapons

extracted_text:
MOGADISHU, July 23 (Xinhua) -- Authorities in the semi- autonomous region of Puntland on Monday said they have seized a boatload of weapons smuggled from Yemen on Friday, a government statement said.

The authorities said the weapons were from the al Qaida in Yemen for local Al-Shabaab group in Somalia which has links with the radical international terror network.
The boat was attempting to smuggle into Puntland State explosives and weapons from Yemen.

"The confiscated materials consist of: 1 speedboat with two motors, one sack of TNT explosives powder weighing 40kilograms, two sacks full of wires, fuses and switches, and five pistols," local Puntland Ministry of Security said in a statement.

Authorities said that one Yemeni national was arrested during the operation which they said was made possible by "the strong cooperation between Puntland Government and local communities in efforts to fight terrorism and piracy".

The nsurgent group of Al-Shabaab have launched attacks against targets in the northeastern state of Puntland which has for the past two decades enjoyed a relative peace and security unlike southern and central parts of the country where Al-Shabaab largely operates.

The Al-Shabaab fighters has been pushed out of key bases in the Somali capital Mogadishu and in parts of the south and north of the country by allied Somali government forces and African Union peacekeeping forces.

Puntland government said it had repeatedly warmed against infiltration of Puntland State by al Qaida terrorist groups in Yemen, and Al-Shabaab fighters fleeing regions in south-central Somalia.

Enditem
